markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Wand of Hybrid Form](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2280)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Polymorph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=127" />
<trait label="Wand" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=164" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 140 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The grain of this simple wooden wand forms shifting images of sharp claws, snapping jaws, and countless creatures.

**Activate** <actions string="" /> Cast a Spell; This activation takes <actions string="Two Actions" /> if the spell normally takes <actions string="Single Action" /> to cast, or <actions string="Three Actions" /> if the spell normally takes <actions string="Two Actions" />;  **Frequency** once per day, plus overcharge;   **Effect** You Cast the Spell, selecting two forms from among those you can normally choose. You gain the benefits of both forms. For example, if one form can breathe air and the other can breathe underwater, you can breathe in both situations. If there's overlap in abilities, you gain the better one. For instance, if both have a fly Speed, you get the higher one, and if both forms have claws, you gain only the claw Strike you prefer. The GM determines which abilities overlap and which are cumulative.

**Craft Requirements** Supply a casting of a spell of the appropriate rank. The spell must have a casting time of <actions string="Single Action" /> or <actions string="Two Actions" />, must have the [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127) trait, and must allow more than one choice of battle form.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
